title: Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
summary: Brussels Sprouts with Bacon might be a good recipe to expand your side dish recipe box. One portion of this dish contains roughly 8g of protein, 11g of fat, and a total of 180 calories. For $1.61 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. If you have olive oil, brussels sprouts, chicken broth, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. It is brought to you by Foodnetwork. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 25 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 64%, this dish is pretty good. Try Bacon Brussels Sprouts, Bacon Brussels Sprouts (Yum!), and Brussels Sprouts with Bacon for similar recipes.
instructions: Watch how to make this recipe.                    Brown bacon in a medium skillet over medium high heat. Remove bacon to a paper towel lined plate. Add extra-virgin olive oil to the pan, 1 turn. Add shallots to the pan and saute 1 to 2 minutes. Add Brussels sprouts and coat in oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cook Brussels sprouts 2 to 3 minutes to begin to soften, then add broth. Bring broth to a bubble, cover and reduce heat to medium low. Cook 10 minutes, until tender. Transfer sprouts to a serving dish with a slotted spoon and top with cooked bacon bits.

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.
Brown bacon in a medium skillet over medium high heat.
Remove bacon to a paper towel lined plate.
Add extra-virgin olive oil to the pan, 1 turn.
Add shallots to the pan and saute 1 to 2 minutes.

Add Brussels sprouts and coat in oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cook Brussels sprouts 2 to 3 minutes to begin to soften, then add broth. Bring broth to a bubble, cover and reduce heat to medium low. Cook 10 minutes, until tender.
Transfer sprouts to a serving dish with a slotted spoon and top with cooked bacon bits.
